meanings.sent1: She consigned the package to the courier for delivery.
meanings.sent2: He consigned the letter to the mailbox for mailing.
meanings.sent3: The cat consigned the mouse to its fate with a flick of its paw.
meanings.sent4: The teacher consigned the homework to the depths of her bag, forgotten.
meanings.sent5: The chef consigned the burnt toast to the trash, disappointed in his mistake.

meanings.sent1: They consigned the task to the most experienced team member.
meanings.sent2: She consigned the project to the new intern for completion.
meanings.sent3: The detective consigned the case to his partner, hoping for fresh insights.
meanings.sent4: The captain consigned the responsibility of navigation to the first mate.
meanings.sent5: The manager consigned the decision-making to the committee, seeking consensus.

meanings.definition: To send or address for sale or disposal
meanings.sent1: The shop consigned the old furniture to the auction house.
meanings.sent2: He consigned his artwork to the gallery for exhibition.
meanings.sent3: The farmer consigned the surplus produce to the local market.
meanings.sent4: She consigned the vintage clothes to the consignment store for resale.
meanings.sent5: The company consigned the outdated inventory to the clearance sale.
